Article Title: Bihar: Humble gamcha has its moment under the sun, courtesy PM Modi
Article Text: NEW DELHI: If one moment conveyed NDA's triumphant mood at the swearing-in ceremony in Patna after its massive poll win, it was the sight of PM Narendra Modi waving a 'gamcha' to the crowd of happy supporters, many of whom cheerfully responded by swinging their own 'gamchas'.A utilitarian accoutrement in everyday life, especially for the working class, the humble 'gamcha' had its proud moment under the sun courtesy Modi. He often wore it during his campaign, and waved it at jubilant BJP supporters at the party's headquarters on Nov 14 when he delivered his victory speech after NDA's massive win of 202 seats in the 243-member assembly.The gamcha is now part of mainstream Bihari dressing culture and the state's distinct identity, a change many will welcome. Parag Goswami, a professor at Pearl Academy, said Modi understands semiotics of culture and fashion and has tapped into the rural and working class identity by taking to the gamcha. As a political prop, it is a great identity marker and Modi conveys to the masses in states like Bihar and UP that he shares their culture code and symbols, he said.He noted that Modi had often connected with people in a similar manner, be it wearing the Assamese gamosa or vesti and angavastram, both associated with TN. These carry layers of meaning are valuable in populist identity-making.
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi waved a 'gamcha' to the crowd of happy supporters at the swearing-in ceremony in Patna. The gamcha is now part of mainstream Bihari dressing culture and the state's distinct identity. Parag Goswami, a professor at Pearl Academy, said Modi understands semiotics of culture and fashion.

Article Title: Watch: Nitish tries to touch Modi's feet at Patna airport; this is how PM reacts
Article Text:
Marking a Political Milestone, Nitish Kumar Sworn In as Bihar CM for the 10th Time





NEW DELHI: Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar on Thursday attempted to touch Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s feet in an unusual moment at the Patna airport, shortly before the PM departed after attending the Janata Dal (United) leader's swearing-in ceremony for a record 10th term.A video of the incident went viral, showing the 74-year-old JD(U) leader walking up to the prime minister and bending down in an apparent attempt to touch his feet.PM Modi immediately stopped him, holding Kumar firmly by the shoulders and clasping both hands of the JD(U) supremo, uttering a few niceties before heading up the aircraft stairs.RJD shared the clip on X, commenting, "In the video, chief minister Nitish Kumar touches Prime Minister Modi's feet at the airport to receive his blessings!"Nitish Kumar, the longest-serving chief minister of Bihar, retained the post despite the BJP outperforming the JD(U) in the recently concluded assembly elections, which saw the NDA win a strong majority.The BJP won 89 seats, JD(U) 85, LJP(RV) 19, HAM 5 and RLM 4, giving the alliance 202 seats in the 243-member House.The NDA’s performance has been credited to the combined appeal of Modi and Nitish, both in their seventies—who have cultivated reputations for governance and women's empowerment, themes that strongly resonated with voters in this election.This is, however, not the first time the JD(U) chief has attempted to touch PM Modi’s feet.Many social media users also pointed out that Kumar had displayed similar behaviour before.In November last year, during an event in Darbhanga, Nitish Kumar bowed down as he approached PM Modi on stage, appearing to touch his feet.The Prime Minister immediately held Kumar’s hands, stood up, and shook hands with him instead.Later in June, during a gathering in Parliament's Central Hall, he attempted the same gesture, catching everyone off guard. In April, he had momentarily touched PM Modi's feet during a Lok Sabha campaign rally in Nawada, an incident that also drew wide attention.
Article Summary: Nitish Kumar is longest-serving chief minister of Bihar. He retained the post despite the BJP outperforming the JD(U) in the recently concluded assembly elections, which saw the NDA win a strong majority. In November last year, during an event in Darbhanga, Kumar bowed down as he approached PM Modi on stage, appearing to touch his feet.

Article Title: 4 of 5 Bihar seats with max & min SIR deletions won by NDA
Article Text:
Nitish Kumar To Take CM Oath For Record 10th Time At Patna's Gandhi Maidan, PM Modi To Attend

NEW DELHI: Though a push from women supporters on account of incentives, including a Rs 10,000 transfer in their bank accounts, was a big factor in NDA's landslide win in Bihar, the alliance wasn't the only beneficiary of high participation in the polls by women. AIMIM walked away with three of the five seats with the highest women voter turnout - namely Kochadhaman, Baisi and Amour - indicating that the correlation between women turnout and electoral outcome was not always straight. AIMIM's total tally was 5 seats. JDU, meanwhile, won in Thakurganj assembly constituency (AC) where 90% of the women turned up, while BJP was the victor in Pranpur, which saw 89% women turnout.The special intensive revision (SIR) exercise in Bihar, conducted amid resistance from the opposition led by Congress, saw NDA parties winning four of the five seats that accounted for the maximum as well as minimum deletions of electors in SIR. Significantly, Congress, with an overall tally of six seats, won Kishanganj despite the AC having recorded the fifth highest deletion among the state's 243 ACs, as well as Chanpatia, which saw second lowest deletion.As per Bihar poll datasets released by EC on Wednesday, BJP won three of the five seats with the highest net deletions - Gopalganj, Purnia and Motihari - followed by JDU, which won Kuchaikote. As regards the five ACs with the least net deletions, BJP and LJPRV won from two each. The datasets linking SIR and poll outcome, thus, do not fit into a pattern. Even so, the four seats (of total five) with the maximum and minimum deletions bagged by NDA are proportional to its overall 83% share in Bihar's 243 seats. Four of the five ACs with the maximum additions made to the Bihar electoral roll between Sept 30 and Oct 20 (the last date of nomination for Phase 2) are now represented by NDA parties, with BJP having its candidates elected from Nautan and Tarari, JDU from Thakurganj, Congress from Araria, and LJPRV from Chenari. The seats that saw the least number of additions to the roll in this period are now represented by JDU, BJP and LJPRV. Among the five seats with the highest winning margin, JDU won in Rupauli and Gopalpur, BJP in Digha and Aurai, and LJPRV in Sugauli. The list of top five ACs with the lowest victory margin includes Sandesh and Nabinagar won by JDU, Ramgarh won by BSP, Agiaon by BJP and Dhaka won by RJD.Congress won from Manihari (ST), the last among the five ACs that clocked the highest male polling percentage. BJP won two of the seats with the highest male voter turnout and three with the lowest male turnout. JDU and LJPRV each bagged one of the five seats with the highest and lowest male polling percentage.Kasba, which recorded the highest total polling percentage at 81.9%, ended up in LJPRV's kitty, Barari and Thakurganj ACs went the JDU way with 81.7% and 81.6% polling, respectively, while Congress bagged Kishanganj with the fifth highest overall turnout of 80.2%. BJP won four of the five seats with the lowest polling percentage - namely Kumhrar, Bankipur, Digha (all in Patna) and Biharsharif - even as JDU bagged Nawada.
Article Summary: AIMIM walked away with three of the five seats with the highest women voter turnout. JDU, meanwhile, won in Thakurganj assembly constituency (AC) where 90% of the women turned up. Congress, with an overall tally of six seats, won Kishanganj despite the AC having fifth highest deletion.

Article Title: Delhi St Columba's School suicide case: 4 teachers suspended; parents says fear of losing 20 internal marks kept Shourya in 'hostile' environment
Article Text:
Image Credit: TOI

Delhi Student Suicide Case: Massive Protest Outside School After Note Alleges Harassment By Teachers

NEW DELHI: Four teachers of St Columba's School, named in an FIR filed in connection with the suicide by Class X student Shourya Patil (16), were on Thursday suspended."The matter is under investigation... In view of the seriousness of the allegations, the competent authority has decided to place you under suspension with immediate effect," the order said, adding the teachers "must stay available for official communication, avoid visiting the school or interacting with students, staff or parents without written permission".Shourya's family returned for his last rites to Sangli, Maharashtra, where his grandparents live. He was cremated at his ancestral village, Dhawaleshwar, in Vita tehsil.Speaking to TOI on the phone, Shourya's father, Pradip Patil, said: "For the past six months, he kept telling us he was being singled out and targeted even for normal conversations, and that teachers were humiliating him. We were repeatedly called to school over very small issues, especially in the past four months."Days before the school vacations, Shourya had pleaded with his father to pull him out. His father had promised he would be shifted after the break. But the harassment was so relentless the teenager could no longer bear it, alleged his family."His vacations were just 8-10 days away. After that, he only had to come for his pre-boards. We had assured him that once this was over, we would shift him to another school for the next two years.Because 20 internal marks are with the school, we didn't want to risk his board performance. We thought it was better not to create conflict with the teachers and just wait it out," he added.Patil described his son as charismatic and cheerful, someone who loved dancing and had recently represented the school at a competition just a month ago. "We were planning a family trip to China after his board exams. It was his wish, everything was already planned," he said.The suicide note found in Shourya's bag stated that he was sorry and that his body parts should be donated to someone in need. It also mentioned the names of the teachers who allegedly humiliated him. "My last wish is that action is taken against them, I don't want any other child to do something like me (sic)," it said.A grief-stricken Patil said, "Especially after reading his note — and I'm staying strong — we will not stop fighting for justice."On Thursday, several parents, former students and family friends gathered in anger and grief. Copies of Shourya's handwritten suicide note were pasted outside the school gates and boundary walls, drawing crowds of parents who stopped to read his final words.Chandrashil Dhawan (35), a relative of the Patils at the protest, said, "Several children have now told us they faced harassment from the same teachers. They were even planning to write everything down and go to the police."He alleged Shourya had been threatened by teachers on the morning of the incident for not performing a dance because of a sprained ankle. He left through the back gate and never reached his pick-up point for his driver to find him. "The next we heard," Dhawan said, "was that he had jumped from the metro station."Parents at the protest said the school's counsellors exist "only on paper" and students do not feel safe approaching them. Former students said the school must end what they described as a "pick-and-point culture" that singles out students repeatedly. Aditya Sagar (18), an alumnus, said, "The school has counsellors, but students rarely approach them about teacher-related issues. They are all part of the same ecosystem, so it doesn't feel like a safe space to complain. "A police team visited the school and interacted with the students. They also secured CCTV footage related to the incident. "We have collected the details of the teachers named in the FIR, and summons will be issued to them to join the investigation," an officer said.
Article Summary: Four teachers of St Columba's School, Delhi, named in an FIR filed in connection with the suicide by Class X student Shourya Patil (16) were on Thursday suspended. The teachers "must stay available for official communication, avoid visiting the school or interacting with students, staff or parents without written permission", the order said.

Article Title: LiAngelo Ball, brother of NBA stars LaMelo and Lonzo Ball, makes Platinum history with breakout hit “Tweaker” featuring Drake

How LiAngelo Ball Went From Basketball to Music Trailblazer

LiAngelo Ball’s transformation from overlooked basketball prospect to music industry headliner has officially reached a historic milestone. His debut single “Tweaker,” released under the stage name Gelo, has achieved platinum status - an achievement that puts him in the same conversation as heavyweight artists like Drake . For an athlete-turned-musician, this level of success is both unprecedented and culturally significant, signaling a genuine crossover moment that few have ever achieved.This accomplishment not only redefines LiAngelo’s public identity but also marks the peak of a rapid rise that began in early 2025. From a player often overshadowed by his brothers Lonzo and LaMelo Ball, LiAngelo has carved out an entirely new lane, proving that his artistic instincts and musical ambition were far more than a curiosity.Released in January 2025, “Tweaker” exploded online almost instantly. Its nostalgic, bouncy beat - powered by piano, organ keys, and lush synth pads - captured the spirit of early-2000s hip-hop. Paired with Gelo’s melodic, sing-song delivery and a catchy “whoa” hook reminiscent of Big Tymers-era anthems, the track resonated widely. Produced by Kunica and Glockie Cheez, the song painted a picture of luxury, swagger, and newfound fame, creating an irresistible vibe that appealed to both younger listeners and fans of classic hip-hop aesthetics.Its momentum grew even stronger as the song spread into sports culture.NBA and NFL teams, including the Detroit Lions, Chicago Bulls, and Cleveland Cavaliers, embraced “Tweaker” as a celebratory anthem in locker rooms and warm-up sessions, pushing its reach far beyond the usual music circles.The success of “Tweaker” eventually led to a massive $13 million record deal with Def Jam and Universal Music Group. The contract included an extraordinary $8 million guaranteed signing bonus—more than what many current NBA players earn annually. This landmark deal solidified Gelo’s credibility and marketability within the hip-hop and R&B world.Adding even more momentum, a high-profile remix featuring Lil Wayne elevated the track’s status, giving it a stamp of approval from one of rap’s most influential figures.“Tweaker” made history by reaching No. 1 on the US Rhythmic Billboard chart - an exceptional feat for a debut single from a former basketball player. The song sparked viral dance trends across social platforms and earned praise from artists like T-Pain, Lil Yachty, and Joe Budden. Its appeal spanned music, sports, and online culture, cementing LiAngelo Ball as 2025’s breakout music star.Before his rise in music, LiAngelo Ball spent years navigating international basketball leagues and the NBA G-League. Eventually, he stepped away from the sport entirely - a decision validated by his explosive success. His debut album League of My Own, released in July 2025, showcased his evolution as an artist and reaffirmed his place in the industry.LiAngelo Ball’s platinum achievement for “Tweaker” is more than a win for himself - it is a defining cultural moment. By stepping into music and dominating charts, he has written a rare success story that bridges athletics, entertainment, and mainstream culture.

The first Test of the Ashes has begun with an unexpected off-field storm, as former England spinner Monty Panesar unleashed a blistering response to Australia's stand-in captain Steve Smith , escalating what has become the most unlikely feud of the series. Smith had earlier mocked Panesar's infamous Celebrity Mastermind appearance while reacting to the former cricketer's advice that England should needle the Australian skipper by resurrecting memories of the 2018 Sandpaper Gate scandal. The Australian star told reporters to “do yourself a favour” and watch Panesar's quiz-show errors — including mixing up Athens' location and calling America a city — calling it “pretty comical”.But Panesar struck back with ferocity in a Telegraph column, claiming he had “won the battle” and branding Smith's press-conference comments as proof of “mental vulnerability” ahead of a blockbuster series opener.“To think that he wanted to talk about me before one of the biggest days of his career… is flattering and nothing short of hilarious,” Panesar wrote. “I cannot believe he has dug out the old YouTube clip of my shocker and memorised it word by word.”Panesar conceded his Mastermind performance was “terrible” and “a shocker”, but insisted it was still preferable to Smith's own missteps. “We've both made mistakes, but at least mine was on a celebrity quiz show.His was on a cricket field, and we both have to live by them. It seems right now only one of us can.”The former spinner went further, saying if he ever confronted Smith, he would question whether the 36-year-old could “look himself in the mirror yet” after Cape Town 2018. “I would ask Steve whether he can actually admit he was part of Sandpapergate — the worst example of Australian cheating in history.”Panesar suggested Smith's reaction proved England had already succeeded in getting inside his head. “I am delighted to have got so far inside his mind… imagine how much damage Ben Stokes and his side are going to be able to do once play starts in Perth?”He even offered sledging scripts for England players: “If I was Jofra Archer, I'd be telling him ‘I'm swinging the ball even without sandpaper'; if I was Joe Root: ‘Fine or coarse paper, mate? Growing up in Rohtak, Nikhil Kashyap spent his teenage years playing tennis-ball cricket and foxing batters with his carrom ball -- an art he learnt after spending hours on YouTube watching R Ashwin 's bowling videos."He (Ashwin) is my idol. I have spent hours watching his videos. He is a magician," Kashyap tells TimesofIndia.com in an exclusive interview."I am a big fan of his variations, especially the way he tricks the right-handed batters," he says.With 24 wickets in five matches, the 25-year-old, in his debut season, has set the Ranji Trophy on fire. The Haryana off-spinner is ninth on the leading wicket-takers list and is the lone off-spinner in the top 20.In a country full of cricketing talent across skills, there is a lack of quality off-spinners coming through the system. They have become an endangered species in Indian cricket . After R Ashwin, Washington Sundar is carrying the baton, but in domestic cricket, the crop seems to have dried up. There are very few who can challenge Washington's place. With leg-spinners and left-arm spinners dominating both white-ball and red-ball formats, off-spinners have slipped down the pecking order.The selectors had their eyes on Pulkit Narang before focus shifted to Tanush Kotian, who was even flown to Australia during the Border Gavaskar Trophy when R Ashwin dropped the retirement bombshell. Madhya Pradesh's Saransh Jain's name is also constantly doing rounds but none have made a pressing case for selection."Being an off-spinner is a challenge," admits Kashyap, who made his first-class debut this season only after veteran off-spinner Jayant Yadav moved to Puducherry."The offies get the ball only if a left-handed batter is at the crease. If the opposition is right-handed heavy, you will see left-arm bowlers operating from both ends. It happens in age-group cricket as well," he says.However, Kashyap, who first held the leather ball at the age of 17 when he joined the Shri Ram Narain Cricket Club (SRNCC) academy in Rohtak, where his coaches Ashwani Kumar and Tejinder Mann not only honed his skills but also made him realise that if he wanted to have a successful career, feels he must not think about match-ups."There is no fear in me. I love bowling to the right-handed batters. There is a different level of satisfaction if you get them out after setting them up in a spell on a flat track," laughs Kashyap.Kashyap, who is a late bloomer, didn’t play age-group cricket for Haryana. But the Haryana Cricket Association (HCA) kept faith in him, and he played two seasons at U-23 level. Last year, he was picked for the Ranji camp, but an unfortunate injury cost him an entire season."The side strain delayed my senior debut for Haryana. I was a bit angry with my luck, but it made me hungry," he says.Like his childhood hero R Ashwin, Kashyap stands 6 feet 2 inches, and he believes that with his height he doesn't rely much on surfaces."A good spinner will take wickets on all pitches. Why R Ashwin is considered a great is because he has done well wherever he has played," he says."I feel bowling on a turner is also an art. You have to pick that one spot and it is not easy because you get greedy as a spinner when you see the turn and bounce. So, you need to be very cautious with your speed, your variations and length," he explains.The lanky spinner says what has helped him in his debut season is his variations."I have four different variations. There is one normal stock ball (off-spin), one slider, arm ball and then carrom ball. I am also working on getting that drift if the pitch is seam-friendly," says Kashyap.Off-spinners are struggling to create an impact in red-ball cricket too, even at the domestic level. In the shorter formats, they rely on multiple variations and can often get away with minor errors because of the spread-out field. But red-ball cricket offers no such cushion; one loose delivery that goes for a boundary immediately releases all the pressure on the batter."It is challenging. But I am relishing every opportunity. I see myself as a wicket-taker, and it has helped me. I go for wickets. The more revs I put on the ball, the better I will become. When the batters step out and hit me over the top, it makes me smile, because I have won half the battle. Because for them, it is a release shot, but for me, I will try and get him out the next time he uses his feet," he says.In modern cricket, white-ball cricket offers more lucrative opportunities and financial rewards than red-ball cricket. However, Kashyap, who is yet to receive a call from an IPL franchise, wants to perform well for Haryana in white-ball cricket and hopes to meet R Ashwin at some point.(I want to meet Ashwin. I need to ask him a few things. I can’t reveal what they are, and I just want to take wickets)," he says.
Article Summary: Haryana off-spinner Nikhil Kashyap is ninth on the leading wicket-takers list. The 25-year-old has set the Ranji Trophy on fire with 24 wickets in five matches. With leg-spinners and left-arm spinners dominating both white-ball and red-ball formats, off- spinners have slipped down the pecking order.

Article Title: 'Not even allowed to fail': Former cricketer questions Sarfaraz Khan's omission from Indian Test team

Sarfaraz Khan

NEW DELHI: Sarfaraz Khan ’s continued absence from the Indian Test team has led to questions from several former players. Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting was recently asked to pick his best no. 4 batter in Test cricket ahead of the Ashes series beginning Friday.At first, given the choice to pick between Kevin Pietersen and Mahela Jayawardene, Ponting picked Pietersen. Article Title: Adin Ross causes storm online after announcing Nick Fuentes recognition in major event with Zack Asmongold
Article Text:
Adin Ross causes storm online after announcing Nick Fuentes recognition in major event with Zack Asmongold (Image Via Getty)

Adin Ross teams up with Zack Asmongold and Nick Lee after Ed Craven ends support





Adin Ross shocked many viewers on November 19, 2025, when he revealed during his Just Chatting livestream that he is planning a new “real” streamer awards show. The short 26-second clip from his stream was posted on X later the same day. In the clip, he said he is teaming up with Zack “Asmongold” and Nick Lee, who is the husband of Kaitlyn “Amouranth,” to create an event that will honor online creators in a different way.He also said something that grabbed even more attention. Adin Ross told his chat that controversial internet figure Nick Fuentes “deserves a f**king award.” He said the awards will not be biased and will not follow the usual pattern of “LA friends” picking each other. He told viewers he wants awards to go to people who “actually deserve awards,” and he wants the event to feel honest and direct.During his November 19, 2025 livestream, Adin Ross explained why he chose to work with Nick Lee and Zack Asmongold. He said he wants a simple and fair event on Kick that gives creators real recognition.He told viewers, “Chat, I’m going to team up with Amouranth’s husband and Asmongold to put on the Kick awards show… We’re going to do streamer awards, and we’re going to do real awards.”He then added, “Nick Fuentes deserves a fking award.”**Two days earlier, on November 17, 2025, Adin Ross had already shared that the first version of the awards show fell apart.He said Kick CEO Ed Craven pulled out of funding the project. Adin Ross explained that the event would cost a lot of money, and he could not pay for everything himself.He told his chat, “Eddie does not want to cover the Kick award stuff anymore. So we are not doing my version of it anymore.”After the funding problem, Nick Lee reached out and offered to support the event, but only if Adin Ross agreed to host and if they considered adding Ice Poseidon.Adin Ross said he was open to making it work with Nick Lee. The new plan is to create a fresh awards show under Kick but with their own rules and choices.As of now, Zack Asmongold has not posted any public response about his involvement in the event.Fans are waiting to see how the three creators will shape the show and whether Nick Fuentes will actually be included in the nominations.Also Read: QTCinderella Faces Backlash After Jasontheween Nomination Clips Spark Criticism From XQc And Asmongold
Article Summary: Adin Ross is teaming up with Zack Asmongold and Nick Lee to create an event that will honor online creators in a different way. He told viewers he wants awards to go to people who “actually deserve awards,” and he wants the event to feel honest and direct.

Article Title: Stephen Curry and Angel Reese could team up for Shaquille O'Neal's marketing masterclass
Article Text:
Stephen Curry; Shaquille O'Neal (Image via X)

Shaquille O'Neal has people talking to Stephen Curry's people

Stephen Curry's decades long partnership with Under Armour came to an end recently, and since then the free agent on the marketing board has been taking his time to decide on which way to go. He has been wearing classic cleats from different sports apparel brands like Nike and Reebok. And now, we hear some chatter that some talks are ongoing, and he might finally choose one over the other.Curry was with UA for 13 years, almost as long as he has been married to his wife, Ayesha Curry. But now he has decided that partnership has run its course for good, and is looking for a new venture. And who better to rope him in for a new journey than NBA veteran, and Curry's good friend, Shaquille O'Neal. Shaq is a Reebok man, a brand that currently has athletes like Chicago Sky's Angel Reese and Chicago Bulls star Matas Buzelis. Now, it seems like a pretty good possibility that Curry and Reese could share the screen for some good ol' marketing masterclass.Yes, the people are talking to the people backstage, or that's what Shaquille O'Neal says. As people might already know, Shaq is the President of Reebok Basketball, and who better to bring in to boost the brand name, then one of the biggest names when it comes to sports - Golden State Warriors' golden boy, Stephen Curry. After Curry was seen sporting the Reebok Shaqnosis, Shaq himself spoke on the matter saying,"Well, he is a good, personal friend of mine, and I think our people are having conversations with his people, I think...It was a big moment for me, a big moment for the brand. It puts everyone in a 'What's he gonna do?' phase, so I wish him well."Previously, Curry had said that he wants to try everything at the moment, without making any commitment so soon. He said, "I'm going to have some fun with this in terms of being open to whatever opportunities are the right fit." But if a good enough deal comes his way, he would hardly say no to that. And a partnership between Curry and Reebok, brought together by Shaq himself, seems like a pretty good deal.Also Read: Stephen Curry’s wife achieves another milestone with nomination at 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards

Article Title: Edmonton Oilers 2025-26 season at risk: Kris Knoblauch demands secondary scoring as Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl face pressure
Article Text:
Kris Knoblauch warns Oilers can’t rely on McDavid and Draisaitl alone (Image via: Getty Images)

Kris Knoblauch calls for balanced scoring across the Oilers’ lines



The Edmonton Oilers are facing a critical stretch in the 2025-26 NHL season, and inconsistency is putting their playoff hopes on shaky ground. Superstar duo Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl continue to dominate offensively, but the team’s reliance on just two players has left the Oilers vulnerable. Fans in Edmonton are growing anxious as repeated one-dimensional performances threaten to stall the team’s momentum.Head coach Kris Knoblauch has now sent a clear message to the roster: it’s time for everyone to contribute. The Oilers cannot afford to depend solely on McDavid and Draisaitl, no matter how dominant they are. “We need to have secondary scoring,” Knoblauch said, via NHL.com. “We can’t rely on Connor and Leon or whoever’s playing with them. We need some bottom-six contributions. Tonight we got some of that, which is good. ”For years, Edmonton’s offense has revolved almost entirely around its superstar duo, Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl. While their talent is undeniable, relying solely on them leaves the team vulnerable. Analysts warn that one-dimensional attacks rarely succeed in the playoffs, where defensive schemes are designed to neutralize top players.Kris Knoblauch’s call for secondary scoring is a crucial step toward creating a more balanced and resilient Oilers lineup.The 2025-26 season represents a pivotal moment for Edmonton. Success now depends on contributions from the bottom six, consistent secondary scoring, and improved defensive support. The roster must rise to the challenge, relieve pressure on the superstar duo, and position the Oilers as legitimate contenders. Knoblauch’s message is totally relying on individual brilliance alone will not carry the team through the season.Adding depth beyond Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl has long-term implications for Edmonton’s championship aspirations. Developing reliable secondary scorers not only strengthens playoff prospects but also boosts confidence across all lines. If the supporting cast consistently contributes offensively, the Oilers can diversify their attack, making it harder for opponents to shut down their stars while positioning the team for sustained success in 2025-26 and beyond.Also Read: Canucks forward David Kampf and wife Elisha expecting baby no. 2; Son Michael to become big brother soon
Article Summary: Kris Knoblauch calls for balanced scoring across the Oilers’ lines. Head coach says Oilers can’t rely on McDavid and Draisaitl alone. Success now depends on contributions from the bottom six, consistent secondary scoring, and improved defensive support.
